Print Page

TRIPENING INC.

TERMS OF SERVICE

  • each user or visitor (collectively “you” or “your”) (i) accessing Tripening’s mobile application on both iOS and Android-powered smart devices (“Mobile App”) and website located at https://www.tripening.com (the “Website”), (ii) using the Services (as defined under Section 2 of these Terms) via the Website and/or Mobile App. (iii) using Tripening’s business-to-business API (as defined under Section 2.4 of these Terms). and/or (iv) making use of Tripening’s widget sub-system to embed the Platform (as defined under Section 2.1 of these Terms) on to such user’s website. 

 

You and Tripening shall also hereinafter be referred to together as the “Parties” and individually as a “Party”.

 

Please read these Terms carefully before using the Website and/or Mobile App. Your access to the Website and/or Mobile App and your use of the Services (as defined below) are conditioned upon your acceptance of and compliance with these Terms. 

 

  1. Acceptance &. Modification of the Terms

 

By accessing the Website and/or Mobile App and by using the Services (defined below) you agree to (i) be bound by these Terms, and (ii) comply with all laws and regulations applicable to such access and use. Should you disagree to be bound by these Terms, in whole or in part, you shall (i) not be permitted/authorized to use the Services (as defined below) on the Platform (as defined below), and (ii) refrain from accessing the Website and/or Mobile App. 

 

Your continued use of the Website, Mobile App and Services on the Platform (as defined below) shall be deemed to constitute your acceptance of these Terms. 

 

Tripening reserves the right, at any time and in its sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms. You shall be solely responsible for checking these Terms periodically, to stay abreast of any changes to the Terms. If you object to any such changes, your sole recourse shall be to cease using the Website, Mobile App and/or Services. Your continued use/access to the Website and/or Mobile App and your continued use of the Services on the Platform (as defined below) following the posting of any changes to these Terms shall indicate your acknowledgement of such changes and satisfaction with the Website, Mobile App and/or Services as so modified and therefore shall be subject to the newly modified Terms.

 

  1. Platform, License &. Services

 

  1. Tripening provides you with a Web-based and mobile AI-driven virtual travel agency platform embedded/integrated in the Website and Mobile App (hereinafter referred to as the “Platform”) in order to facilitate your use of the Services (defined below). 

 

  1. License Grant. Tripening hereby grants you a limited, revocable, non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-sublicensable license to use the Platform via the Website and/or Mobile App in strict compliance with the terms and conditions of the present Terms. All rights not expressly granted to you hereunder are and shall be reserved by Tripening and its licensors.

 

  1. Tripening, via the Platform and its Third Party Vendors, provides you with a range of travel-related services including but not limited to:

 

  1. tours and attractions including but not limited to (a) walking trails, riding, boating, and air-tours, and (b) amusement parks, museums, and points of interest;
  2. flights to destinations around the globe, with flights including all classes of carriage,  . flight ancillaries (including but not limited to seat upgrades, meals and bags), travel insurance, and cancellation/interruption insurance;
  3. car rentals, available in all car classes and ancillaries (including but not limited to GPS rentals, car seat rentals, and mile upgrades), car insurance options and upgrades;
  4. cruises available in all cabin classes (including but not limited to ancillaries such as WiFi access, cruise-perks, dining and on-board credit facilities); 
  5. hotel stays and vacation rentals (including room upgrades and ancillaries such as WiFi access);
  6. shuttles and taxis (including shared rides, private cabs, and bag upgrades);
  7. customized or pre-arranged holiday packages, which you have the option to design (customized) or choose from the available  selection of pre-arranged packages;
  8. travel insurance: Trippening via, its Third Party Vendors (defined below) may provide you with a range of optional (travel) insurance products;
  9. participation in Tripening’s online community, which allows you to (a) interact with other users, (b) leave reviews on products and/or vendors, (c) suggest places of interest, (d) provide trip reports with images, and (e) post comments or vote on such trip reports;
  10. the ability for you and other users to remotely collaborate and build/design a customized trip together. and
  11. the ability for you to register a family User Account (defined below) on the Platform which allows the User Account holder to (a) set up sub-accounts for the user’s family members, (b) approve requests, and (c) issue tickets to the sub-account holder on the Platform.

 

(collectively the “Service(s)”).

 

  1. Tripening uses an Application Programming Interface (“API”) software to: 

 

  1. collect non-identifiable information on how you use the Website and Mobile App, analyze guest product reviews and Tripening’s community activities. The purpose of the API in the aforementioned instance is to allow Tripening to recommend and customize the Website, Mobile App and Services for you, and provide more information and suggestions that may be relevant to you. and 
  2. analyze all User Generated Content (defined below) and allow you to share your User Generated Content (defined below) on the Platform and via social media networks.

 

  1. Tripening also makes the API available to its business partners, so that the Services can be used by such business partner’s clients/customers/end-users, 

 

  1. You acknowledge and agree that if any itinerary and destination(s) you select on the Website and/or Mobile App, is based on information which you have gleaned from third party brochures and/or the Internet. Tripening shall not be responsible or liable for such information contained on third parties’ brochures and on the Internet because Tripening has no control over the third parties who/which compiled, managed and updated such information. Accordingly, Tripening does not guarantee that the itinerary you have selected on the Website and/or Mobile App will comply in whole or in part with the information you have obtained from such third party brochure and/or from the Internet. Any right of recourse you may have in regards to the information you have obtained from third party brochures and/or from the Internet, must only be taken against the applicable third party who provided such information.

 

  1. You acknowledge that Tripening may add, change, suspend, remove or discontinue any part/content or all of the Services, Website and/or Mobile App, in its sole discretion at any time, without notice and for any or no reason.

 

  1. You covenant that you shall not (i) use the Website, Mobile App and Services in any illegal or unlawful manner or for any illegal or unlawful purposes, and (ii) perform any act, which interferes with or disrupts the Website, Mobile App, API and Services. 

 

  1. Tripening shall have no obligation to monitor your activity on the Website and/or Mobile App. However, Tripening reserves the right to (i) review and remove any of the User Generated Content (defined below) in its sole discretion. (ii) terminate your access to the API and Services at any time, without notice and for any or no reason whatsoever. and (iii) disclose any information as Tripening deems necessary to comply with any applicable law, regulation, legal process or governmental request.

 

  1. Third Party Vendors. You acknowledge and understand that Tripening uses a variety of service providers to deliver the Services to you (“Third Party Vendor(s)”). These Third Party Vendors are independent contractors and as such are not agents, officers or employees of Tripening. To the extent permitted by law, Tripening (i) shall not be liable for any injury, damage, death, loss and/or accident you experience, or for any delay in the provision to you of the Service(s) due to any act or omission of any of its Third Party Vendors. (ii) does not accept responsibility for any injury, damage, death, loss and/or accident you experience, or for any delay in the provision to you of the Service(s) due to sickness, pilferage, labor disputes, bankruptcy, machinery breakdown, quarantine, epidemic, pandemic, government restraints, weather, terrorism or causes beyond Tripening’s control. (iii) shall not be liable (including any liability in tort) for any Third Party Vendor's breach of warranty, or for any other wrongdoing of Tripening’s Third Party Vendor in relation to the performance  of the Services by the Third Party Vendor. and (iv) shall not be responsible for any Third Party Vendor’s  failure to comply with the details and description of the Services ordered by you or with applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

 

  1. You agree to abide by any additional terms and/or conditions of purchase imposed by any Third party Vendor, for any of the Services listed on the Platform. You acknowledge and understand that any violation of the Third Party Vendor’s terms and conditions of purchase in relation to the Services listed on the Platform may result in (i) the cancellation of your request(s), booking(s), reservation(s) or purchase(s). (ii) you being denied access to any flights, hotels, or car rentals, or other Service. (iii) you forfeiting any amounts paid to Tripening and the Third Party Vendor(s) for such request(s), booking(s), reservation(s) or purchase(s), and (v) Tripening debiting your credit/debit account for any and all costs Tripening may incur as a result of such violation. 

 

  1. Support Services

Tripening may, in its sole discretion, provide reasonable support services to you, via the Website chat, onsite forms, email or calls, aimed at addressing any queries you may have and/or any technical issues you may experience, while using the Services. Tripening’s support services may include but shall not be limited to (i) instructions on how to use the Services, (ii) solving issues you may experience with the use of the Services, and (iii) solving any issues you may have as a result of your incorrect use of the Services.

 

  1. Registration, Login Credentials &. Security

 

  1. Upon your placing of an order for a Service on the Platform, a User Account (as defined below) is automatically created by Tripening for you. However, such User Account (as defined below) shall remain inactive until you click on the ‘create an account’ button on the Website, Mobile App or contained in the email sent by Tripening to you.

 

  1. To earn rewards and gain other benefits, as further described under Section 12,  you must register on the Website or Mobile App by providing all required information which shall include but not be limited to your full name, email address, social media network token (should you register by authenticating your details via your login credentials held with a third party social media network), and contact information. You acknowledge and agree that in order to verify the validity of the information you have provided to Tripening when registering, Tripening shall send you a link via email and/or text message (sms). Upon receipt of the link, you shall click on such link so as to verify and confirm your email address and telephone number. 
  1. After verification, an account may thereafter be opened by Tripening, in its sole discretion, for you on the Website and Mobile App (“User Account”). You acknowledge and agree that Tripening may, in its sole discretion, deny you access to its Website, Mobile App, Platform and/or Services for any reason or no reason at all.
  1. You agree to:

 

(i)  .  .  provide true, accurate, current and complete information about yourself as prompted by Tripening’s registration process on the Website or Mobile App. and

(ii)  .  .  maintain and promptly update the information provided during registration to keep it true, accurate, current, and complete at all times.

  1. If you provide any information to Tripening that is untrue, inaccurate, outdated, or incomplete, or if Tripening has reasonable grounds to suspect that such information is untrue, inaccurate, outdated, or incomplete, Tripening may close your User Account on the Website and Mobile App and deny you the ability to access and use the Services.
  1. You may indicate to Tripening, during the registration process, your choice of User Account’s username (i.e. your email address or phone number) and password to be used as login credentials to access your User Account (“Login Credentials”). You shall be solely responsible for (i) maintaining the confidentiality of your Login Credentials. and (ii) any and all activities which occur under your User Account. 
  1. Security. You agree to notify Tripening immediately of any unauthorized use of your User Account or any other breach of security. Tripening shall not be liable for any loss that you may incur as a result of any third party using your Login Credentials and/or accessing/using your User Account either with or without your knowledge. However, you may be held liable for losses incurred by Tripening due to any third party using your Login Credentials and/or User Account. You acknowledge and agree that you may not (i) use the User Account of another user registered on the Website or Mobile App without the express permission of such User Account holder, and (ii) impersonate any individual or entity, or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent any affiliation with an individual or entity when accessing the Website and Mobile App and when using the Services on the Platform.
  1. Pricing of the Services, Intermediary Fee, Payment Terms &. Taxes

 

  1. As an intermediary, Tripening collects money from you for the Services, for and on behalf of the Third Party Vendors. Tripening shall ensure to publish and maintain accurate prices and information related to the Services on the Website and Mobile App. You acknowledge and understand that Tripening’s Third Party Vendors provide Tripening with the price, availability and information related to the Services on the Platform. In the event that the Service(s) on the Platform has an incorrect price or contains inaccurate information on the Service being provided by the Third Party Vendor, due to a typographical error or other error as received from the Third Party Vendor, Tripening may refuse or cancel any requests, bookings and/or reservations made for the applicable Service(s), irrespective of whether or not (i) your request, booking and/or reservation has been confirmed by the Third Party Vendor, and/or (ii) your credit/debit card has been charged for the relevant Service(s). However, in the event that your credit/debit card  was charged for the purchase of the cancelled Service(s) while your request, booking and/or reservation was cancelled as a result of an incorrect price or information (for example: incorrect hotel, airline, or car rental information), Tripening will promptly issue you with a refund to your credit/debit account in the amount of the charge made to your credit/debit card for the Service(s). You acknowledge that the Services advertised by Tripening on the Platform are subject to availability by the Third Party Vendor and can be withdrawn or varied by Tripening at any time without notice to you.

 

  1. Intermediary Fee. 
  1. As a facilitating intermediary/entity which is only a third party to any Services purchased by you on the Platform, Tripening shall collect from your payment method, a fee as compensation for the Services listed on the Platform and provided to you via Third Party Vendors (“Intermediary Fee”). The Intermediary Fee includes but is not limited to the cost of facilitating your booking(s) and/or reservation(s) with the Third Party Vendors, administrative fees, transaction  fees, and customer service costs.
  1.  You acknowledge and agree that the Intermediary Fee collected by Tripening for some of the Services you purchase on the Platform, may, upon your cancellation of such Service(s) for any reason, be non-refundable.
  1. Except as described below in Section 5.4, Tripening shall not be responsible for collecting and remitting taxes to the applicable taxing authorities on behalf of its Third Party Vendors. Tripening’s Third Party Vendors may include all applicable taxes in the pricing for the Services listed on the Platform. As such, Tripening pays the  Third Party Vendor all amounts you pay for the Services listed on the Platform, less Tripening’s Intermediary Fee, directly to its Third Party Vendors. Tripening is not associated with any Third Party Vendor with whom you book or reserve your  . travel arrangements via the Platform. You acknowledge, understand and agree that any applicable Taxes (defined below) and the appropriate tax rate charged by the Third Party Vendor, varies greatly by location and the industry within which the Third Party Vendor belongs to.

 

  1. Payment Terms. Payment for the Services on the Platform shall be due on or before the date specified on the Website or Mobile App. Should Tripening not receive payment for the Services (including the Intermediary Fee) you have selected on the Platform at the time of the purchase of the Service(s), Tripening and/or the Third Party Vendor may cancel your booking or reservation.
  1. Taxes. 

 

  1. Under these Terms, the term “Taxes” shall mean taxes, charges, duties, fees, levies, assessments and other charges of a governmental authority, including income, withholding, social security, social contribution, transfer, sales, use, value-added and all other taxes of any kind for which a Party may have any liability imposed by any governmental authority, whether disputed or not, any related charges, interest or penalties imposed by any governmental authority, and any liability for any other person as a transferee or successor by Law, contract or otherwise.

 

  1. All pricing for the Services, as displayed on Tripening’s Website and Mobile App are exclusive of any and all Taxes paid by the Third Party Vendors.

 

  1. You shall be responsible for the payment of all Taxes associated with your purchase of the Services via the Platform. You shall not deduct from the payments, owed to Tripening and any applicable Third party Vendor, any Taxes, except as required by applicable law.
  1. You acknowledge and agree that you shall be solely and exclusively responsible for all Taxes arising out of your use of the Website and Mobile App.
  1. Booking &. Reservations

 

  1. Once you have completed all applicable fields to enquire about a particular destination, trip, tour, car rental, accommodation and/or any other Service available for booking on the Platform. or initiated such an enquiry by any other means of communication including by means of access to the Website, Mobile App and API, Tripening will provide you with the total price of your request (the “Quote(s)’). Once you have accepted the Quote you will follow the steps  indicated on the Website or Mobile App. Full payment of the total value of the Quote is required upfront in order to confirm your booking or reservation with the relevant Third Party Vendor. Once you have authorized Tripening and/or the Third Party Vendor to process the payment for your booking/reservation, Tripening will send you one or several emails confirming your booking/reservation and all its related details. In case of multiple bookings with several Third Party Vendors, should you or Tripening fail to confirm one or more bookings/reservations with the relevant Third Party Vendor(s), you acknowledge and agree that Tripening will (i) only process the bookings/reservations you have expressly confirmed, (ii) charge your payment method only for the total amount of the confirmed booking(s)/reservation(s), and (iii) remove any discounted rates that may have applied to the total amount representing both confirmed and non-confirmed bookings/reservations.

 

  1. When you request a Quote, when you make a reservation or when the Services are made available  to you by Tripening via the Platform, you shall be deemed to have read and accepted these Terms and to have the authority to agree to these Terms on behalf of any other person in whose name the Quote, booking or reservation is made.

 

  1. All Quotes Tripening may provide to you, and any bookings or reservations made by you on the Website and Mobile App, are subject to (i) the availability of the Service(s) from the Third Party Vendor, and (ii) you providing the Third Party Vendor with any additional information/documentation. The bookings’ and reservations’ period of validity shall be based on Third Party Vendor’s terms and conditions at the time Tripening provides you with a Quote for the booked/reserved Service(s). You acknowledge and agree that you shall submit prompt payment in accordance with the deadline(s) specified by Tripening on the Website and Mobile App Travel. Should you fail to make prompt payment for your selected Service(s) on the Platform, such failure will result in (i) the cancellation of the booking or reservation, (ii) the expiry of the Quote, and (iii) the possible increase in the price for the Service(s) when you next request another Quote and/or make another booking/reservation for the same Service package.

 

  1. Passports, Visas &. Health

 

  1. You shall be solely responsible for ensuring that all passports, necessary visas (for both final and transiting countries) and travel permits are current, obtained on time and that your passport will be valid for six (6) months to one (1) year after your return to your home country. You shall further ensure that your passport contains sufficient blank pages for visa issuance. You agree to comply with any test/vaccination requirements including any specific Covid-19-related requirements imposed by the country/ies you travel to/from (i.e. testing, screening, quarantine, etc.).
  1. Visa and entry requirements may vary depending on your country of origin, your departure country, the length of stay and purpose of visit, amongst other factors. All visas and information can be obtained by contacting the applicable Consulate or Embassy of the countries you are travelling to or from a visa service company.
  1. All the requirements listed under this Section 7 must be checked, acknowledged and adhered to, before traveling. You acknowledge, understand and agree that any recommendations/suggestions provided by Tripening to you, including but not limited to information on visas, entry requirements, immigration, residency or Covid-19 requirements/regulations shall not be interpreted as specialist’s advice.

 

  1. Tripening shall not be responsible, liable or under any obligation for any consequence of any nature arising from your failure to ensure that you have complied with all such requirements (under present Section 7). Tripening shall endeavour to assist with all necessary information however, you acknowledge that this should not replace your responsibility in verifying and comply with all relevant requirements prior to your departure date. Tripening shall not be held responsible for any (i) denial of a visa application for any reason. (ii) delay of issuance of the visa by the relevant Consulate or High Commission. (iii) loss of a passport(s) by the consular offices and/or courier. (iv) change in visa costs and requirements. (v) any financial loss incurred by you as a result of a visa application being denied. passport application delays. and/or (vi) incorrect issuance of passport or visa.
  1. Insurance

 

  1. Tripening recommends that, prior to departure, you purchase adequate travel insurance cover for the duration of your trip, so as to be covered in case of (i) cancellation of your booking or reservation, (ii) worldwide epidemics (such as SARS, Coronavirus), (iii) illness, accident or injury, (iv) personal liability, and/or (v) loss or damage of baggage/personal equipment.
  1. You acknowledge that any travel insurance referred to you by Tripening, on the Website and Mobile App, shall be subject to the terms and conditions of the Third Party Vendor providing such insurance policy. 
  1. Tripening shall not be liable should you fail to take adequate insurance cover. In addition, Tripening shall assume no responsibility in the event of a Third Party Vendor’s default, or cessation of the Service(s) being provided to you by the Third Party Vendor. For any dispute, or query regarding your insurance policy, you shall have recourse only against the relevant/applicable Third Party Vendor and Tripening shall not be responsible or liable for any loss, harm, damage, and costs of whatsoever nature and howsoever incurred in connection with your travel arrangements and the use of the Service(s) on the Platform.
  1. Cancellations &. Refunds 

 

  1. If you wish to cancel or request a refund for the Service(s) you have booked/reserved, cancellation penalties may apply in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Service(s) you have purchased on the Website and/or Mobile App. These terms and conditions will be determined by the applicable Third Party Vendor responsible for the provision of the Service(s) booked/reserved by you on the Platform. Tripening shall not be responsible for (i) you forfeiting any deposit(s) previously paid to the applicable Third Party Vendor for the relevant Service(s). (ii) any applicable cancellation costs or administrative charges that a Third Party Vendor may impose on you. or (iii) Tripening’s failure to obtain any refund from any Third Party Vendors on your behalf. Furthermore, you acknowledge and agree that Tripening may, in its sole discretion, determine that you forfeit any deposit previously paid to the applicable Third Party Vendor,  . irrespective of the Third Party Vendor’s terms and conditions.
  1. Cancellation and refund policies will be outlined/detailed under each Service page provided on the Platform and shall be restated on your booking/reservation order form/voucher. The cancellation and refund policies in effect at the time of your purchase of the Service(s) shall apply in case of cancellation of the relevant Service or in case of refund request made by you. 

 

  1. You acknowledge, understand and agree that some Services, which are sold on the Platform at a lower rate, may carry non-refundable penalties.
  1. Considering that Tripening acts solely as a third party intermediary, Tripening can only assist you in processing your refund request with the applicable Third Party Vendor and following up on the status of your refund with such Third Party Vendor. You understand that Tripening will only give you a refund upon receipt by Tripening of the refund amount from the relevant Third Party Vendor.
  1. Chargeback Policy

 

  1. Should you have a question about a charge on your credit or debit card statement, Tripening recommends that you first contact Tripening prior to disputing the charge with your credit /debit card company. Tripening shall endeavour to discuss any questions or concerns you may have about any and all charges made to your credit or debit card in relation to the Services on the Platform, and Tripening will work with you in resolving your concerns. 
  1. You acknowledge and agree that Tripening retains the right to: 

(i)  .  .  investigate, dispute, rebut and recover costs from you in relation to any chargeback, which Tripening believes in its sole discretion to be improper, including but not limited to chargebacks (a) resulting from non-cancellable reservations, (b) resulting from charges made to your credit/debit card by authorized family members, friends or other third parties, (c) arising from the Third Party Vendor’s failure to deliver a product or service in a manner that is consistent with the Third Party Vendor’s  . product/service description, or (d) resulting from a Force Majeure Event (defined below). and

(ii)  .  .  cancel any travel reservation in the event of a chargeback related to such reservation.

  1. By using the Services to make a reservation via any of Tripening’s Third Party Vendors on the Website and/or Mobile App, you agree to the relevant cancellation and refund policy of such Third Party Vendor(s) and/or Tripening. The Third Party Vendor’s cancellation / refund policy applicable to each reservation made by you shall be made available by Tripening to you on the Website and Mobile App. You acknowledge that certain rates or promotions displayed by Tripening on the Platform may not be eligible for cancellation, refund or change. 

 

  1. Tickets

 

  1. Upon making payment for the Services on the Platform, you will receive a ticket ("Ticket(s)") for the Service you booked on the Website or Mobile App. In order to access and print your Ticket, you will be directed to a secure webpage hosted by Tripening that contains a link to your Ticket. Your Ticket will also be emailed to you by Tripening. 
  2. You must provide the Ticket in (i) print format if stipulated on the Ticket. or (ii) digital format available on Tripening’s Mobile App. or (iii) pdf format as emailed to you by Tripening, to the applicable Third Party Vendor in order to make use of the Service(s) you have purchased on the Platform. You acknowledge that you may also need to supply additional information/documentation to the applicable Third Party Vendor to validate your booking and/or reservation. 
  3. For security purposes, when redeeming your Ticket you must present a valid photo ID and meet any other requirement as requested by Tripening on the Website and Mobile App, or by any of its relevant Third Party Vendors.

 

  1. Rewards and Promotions 

 

  1. Tripening provides all of its users (including you), via its Third Party Vendors, with the ability to accumulate reward points. The number of reward points you accumulate will determine your status on the Website and Mobile App. You may obtain reward points by increasing your activity on the Website and Mobile App, including without limitation by (i) registering for a User Account, (ii) signing up for Tripening’s newsletter, (iii) inviting friends to visit the Website and/or Mobile App, and/or (iv) purchasing the Services on the Platform. Depending on your status level on the Website and Mobile App, the applicable Third party Vendor may offer you (i) special promotions, such as free upgrades, discounts and other rewards. and (ii) the opportunity to participate in online games and obtain virtual tokens and gifts.

 

  1. You acknowledge and understand that each Service offered on promotion at  discounted rates may be valid for a limited period as determined by Tripening in its sole discretion. You understand and agree that deposits or payments made by you in full for in order to make a booking/reservation during this limited promotional period may be non-refundable, non-exchangeable or non-changeable, in accordance with Tripening’s specific terms and conditions of such promotion and as provided on the Website and Mobile App.

 

  1. Acceptable Use of the Website and Mobile App

 

  1. You may not use the Website and/or Mobile App to transmit, distribute, store or destroy any material or information (i) in violation of any applicable law or regulation. (ii) in a manner that infringes Tripening’s Intellectual Property Rights (defined below) or any third party’s intellectual property rights. (iii) in a manner that violates the privacy or other personal rights of third parties. (iv)  that is defamatory, obscene, threatening, abusive or hateful, and/or (v) in order to upload, post, email, transmit, or otherwise make available any content that shall be deemed unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, vulgar, obscene, libelous, or invasive of another's privacy or which is hateful, and/or racially, ethnically, or otherwise objectionable.

 

  1. When accessing the Website or Mobile App, you shall be prohibited from:

 

  1. using any device, software or the like to interfere or attempt to interfere with the proper functioning of the Website or Mobile App;
  2. taking any action that imposes an unreasonable or disproportionately large data load on the Website’s or Mobile App’s infrastructure;
  3. copying, reproducing, altering, modifying, creating derivative works, or publicly displaying any content from the Website or Mobile App without Tripening’s prior written consent;
  4. accessing, tampering with, or use non-public areas of the Website, Mobile App and/or Services, of Tripening’s computer systems and/or of Tripening’s third party providers’ technical delivery systems; 
  5. probing, scanning, or testing the vulnerability of any of Tripening’s system or network or breach or circumvent any of Tripening’s security or authentication measures; 
  6. accessing, searching or attempting to access or search the Website, Mobile App and/or Services by any means other than through Tripening’s currently available, published interfaces that are provided by Tripening, unless you have been specifically allowed to do so in a separate agreement with Tripening; 
  7. reverse-assembling, reverse-engineering, decompiling or otherwise attempting to discover any source code relating to the Website, Platform, Mobile App and/or Services or any tool therein, except to the extent that such activity is expressly permitted by applicable law notwithstanding this limitation;
  8. attempting to access any area of the Website or Mobile App to which access is not authorized; 
  9. using any robot, spider, other automatic device or manual process to monitor or copy any part of the Website or Mobile App;
  10. conducting any systematic or automated data collection activities on or in relation to the Website or Mobile App, including but not limited to data scraping, mining, extraction, harvesting, framing and article spinning, without Tripening’s prior written consent; 
  11. using manual or automated software, devices, or other processes to “crawl,” “scrape,” or “spider” any page of the Website or Mobile App;
  12. using the Website or Mobile App to transmit or send unsolicited commercial and marketing communications for any purpose, without Tripening’s prior written consent;
  13. uploading, posting, emailing, transmitting, or otherwise offering any unsolicited or unauthorized advertising, promotional flyers, "junk mail," "spam," or any other form of solicitation, except in any such areas that may have been designated for such purpose;

Tripening’s Privacy Policy

 

Last Modified: Nov. 10th 2020 (“Effective Date”)

INTRODUCTION

This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) is designed to inform you about Tripening Inc. (“Tripening,” “we,” “us,” or “our”) policies and procedures for collecting, using, and disclosing your information in connection with your use of Tripening services. Tripening provides online travel agency services, (the “Services”) for our users (“Users”). 

Users can access our Services through our website located at https://www.tripening.com (“Site”), through integrations via our API, and through our applications on their Devices. A “Device” is any computer used to access the Tripening Service, including without limitation a desktop, laptop, mobile phone, tablet, or other consumer electronic device.

SCOPE

This Privacy Policy governs your access of the Tripening Services, regardless of how you access it, and explains what data we collect when you use the Site and/or the Services, why we collect the data, how it is used, and your rights and choices. This policy applies to personal data and other information collected by us from or about: (i) visitors of our Site, (ii) Users, (iii) prospective clients, (iv) current clients, (v) job applicants.

By using our Site or the Services you consent to the collection, transfer, processing, storage, disclosure and other uses described in this Privacy Policy.

1. INFORMATION WE COLLECT

When you interact with the Site or the Services and in connection with our events, sales and marketing activities, we collect information that alone or in combination with other information could be used to identify you (“Personal Data”), as described below:

A. Information You Provide as a User
 When you register an account as a User, you may be asked to provide Personal Data including without limitation, your name, phone number, email address, home address.

When using the Services, you may also provide us with your financial or banking information so that we are able to process your booking requests, for example to book a hotel for you.  

You may also choose to submit Personal Data to us when you send us an email or use any interactive features that we may make available on the Services. For example, you may ask us to: (a) import your contacts by giving us access to your third party services (such as your email account) or (b) use your social networking information if you give us access to your account on social network connection services.

You may also provide us with your contacts’ email addresses if you invite them to join Tripening. 

B. Events
 We may also collect data from you including without limitation when you attend one of our events, during phone calls with sales representatives, or when you contact customer support.

C. Employment Applications
 When you apply for employment through the Site, our provider of recruiting services will collect your resume and any additional information that you elect to provide to us, including but not limited to your employment history and education. In addition, where permitted by law, we may use a third party to carry out a background check to determine your suitability for a position.

D. Automatically Collected Information
i. Log Data.

When you use the Services, we automatically record information from your Device, its software, and your activity using the Services. This includes the Device’s Internet Protocol (IP) address, operating system, browser type, the web pages you visited before you came to the Site, the web pages you view immediately after leaving our Site, information you search for on the Site, locale preferences, identification numbers associated with your Devices, your mobile carrier, date and time stamps associated with transactions, system configuration information, metadata, and other interactions with the Services.

We collect this information in order to deliver the Services and to provide our Users with reporting and analytics relating to the use of the Services. This information is made available to Users via the Services (for example, we provide Users with information on the use of their custom replies) and may be associated with other information about the User.

ii. Other information collected via Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies.

We use “cookies” (small data files that we transfer to your Device) and other tracking technologies to operate and administer the Site and the Services, analyze trends and improve your access to, and use of, our Services. For more information about the cookies and similar technologies used on our Site and Services, please refer to our Cookie Policy annexed to this Privacy Policy.

2. HOW WE USE INFORMATION

A. Provide Information. Respond to Requests
 When you ask for information about the Services (for example, when you request a demo or ask us to send you offers or price information), or register to a webinar or an event, we will use your contact information to respond to your request. Such use is necessary to respond to or implement your request.

B. Provide the Services to Users
 We use data provided by Users in connection with the purchase, sign-up, use, or support of the User account (such as usernames, email address and billing information) to provide you with access to the Services and/or the Site, contact you regarding your use of the Services and/or the Site, or to notify you of important changes to the Services and/or the Site. Such use is necessary for the performance of the contract between you and us. To provide Users with our Services, we may share their data with third parties. 

C. Sending Marketing Communications and Other Announcements
 Where required by applicable law (for example, if you are an EU data subject), we will only send you marketing information by email or mail, or contact you by phone, if you consent to us doing so at the time you provide us with your Personal Data. When you provide us with your consent to be contacted for marketing purposes, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time by following the instructions to “opt-out” of receiving marketing communication in each marketing email we send you. In addition, if at any time you do not wish to receive future marketing communications or wish to have your name deleted from our mailing or calling lists, please contact us at privacy@tripening.com. Please note that if you opt out from marketing communications, we may still contact you regarding issues related to our Services and to respond to your requests.

D. For Legitimate Business Interests
 We use data relating to your use of and interaction with the Site and the Services, including information that we receive through cookies and similar technologies, for certain legitimate business interests, which are the following:

  • to provide, administer, and support the Site and the Services;
  • to personalize and improve your access to and use of the Site and the Service (including to increase our Services’s functionality, product features, and user-friendliness);
  • to verify Users have the authorization needed for the Services to process their requests;
  • to inform our marketing strategy and personalize our communications with you (including providing or offering software updates, information on our features and other marketing and service-related announcements relevant to the content and features you engage with);
  • to conduct analytics and report on industry trends on content usage and performance;
  • to meet our corporate and social responsibility objectives;
  • if you ask us to delete your data or to be removed from our marketing lists and we are required to fulfil your request, we will keep basic data to identify you and prevent further unwanted processing. and
  • for internal business/technical operations, including troubleshooting, data analysis, testing, to prevent fraud or criminal activity, misuses of our products or services and ensure the security of our IT systems, architecture, and networks.

This use of your Personal Data is necessary for our legitimate interests in understanding how the Site and our Services are being used by you and to improve your experience on it.

3. INFORMATION SHARING AND DISCLOSURE

A. Your Use
 We will display your Personal Data on your profile page and elsewhere on the Services according to the preferences you set in your account.

B. Our Travel Partners
  We also disclose your Personal Data, if necessary, to process your request and deliver our Services, to our Travel Partners, so that we can book events, tickets, or hotel nights for you. We might also share sensitive information, only when required by our Travel Partners (such as special assistance needs to book a flight). These third parties have access to your Personal Data for the purpose of performing these specific tasks on our behalf and pursuant to our instructions.

C. Our AI assistant chatbot
  To provide our Services to our Users and improve our Services for a better experience, we will share your data with LiveChat. However, we anonymize this data so that no identification is possible. 

C. Employees, Services Providers, Business Partners, and Others

These third parties may have access to your Personal Data for the purpose of performing these tasks on our behalf and pursuant to our instructions.

Tripening’s Cookie Policy

Tripening uses cookies and similar technologies on our Site and Services to operate and administer our Site and the Services, gather usage and performance data and give you a personalized experience with Tripening. 

This Cookie Policy (“Cookie Policy”) provides information about how and when we use cookies and similar technologies for these purposes and the choices that you have. It forms part of Tripening' Privacy Policy. Capitalized terms used in this Policy but not defined have the meaning set forth in our Privacy Policy.

1. COOKIES AND OTHER TECHNOLOGIES

A cookie is a piece of information sent to your browser from a website and stored on your computer’s hard drive. Cookies can help a website like ours recognize repeat users and allow a website to track web usage behavior. Cookies work by assigning a number to the user that has no meaning outside of the assigning website. For more details on cookies and similar technologies please visit All About Cookies.

Cookies can be stored on your computer for different periods of time. “Session cookies” only last for as long as the browser session and are deleted automatically once you close your browser. “Persistent cookies” cookies survive after your browser is closed until a defined expiration date set in the cookie (as determined by the third party placing it), and help recognize your computer when you open your browser and browse the Internet again. We use “persistent cookies” to save your registration ID and login password for future logins to the Services. We use “session ID cookies” to enable certain features of the Services, to better understand how you interact with the Services, and to monitor aggregate usage and web traffic routing on the Services.

We also use pixel tags (usually in combination with cookies), from the third parties described below, to get information about your usage of the Site and the Services and your interaction with email or other communications. Pixel tags are a technology similar to cookies that can be embedded in online content or within the body of an email for the purpose of tracking activity on websites (for example, to know when content has been shown to you), or to know when you have viewed particular content or a particular email message.
